activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John R Contos

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ae] case 1:22 PM Defendant John R Contos appeared by phone.Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the phone-connection is sound sufficient. 

The Court reviews case history and asks the Defendant that status of obtaining counsel
The Defendant states he would like to see discovery before deciding if he is going to retain counsel. 
After the Defendant is advised that discovery is not made available until after the preliminary hearing, Mr. Contos requests additional time to hire an attorney before the next hearing. 
The Court will schedule one more additional status of counsel, time limits remain tolled.

recess 1:30 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Adjourned Initial Appearance 11/18/22 at 10;00 am via Zoom

Order to Seal Victim Key
The original document was titled: Victim Witness Key
The original history event date is: 10-11-2022
Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Bond Document rec'd from JESO on 10/12/22

[ma] Case called at 1:58 PM 
Defendant John R Contos appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (PD appears for bond-purposes only, Mr. Contos declined to be evaluated).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Victim Rights Verified 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls time limits

The Court requires a $500 CASH  Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

recess 2:05  pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 10/19/22 at 1:15pm (status of counsel?)
Proposed Order to Seal Victim Key
